X-Location-Id.description: This header returns the unique identifier for the resource that was just created. For hotel stays, this will be the UO order_id, if available. If the hotel stay was created outside the UO booking flow and has no order_id, the header can be dropped from the response

Location.description: The Location response header indicates the URL to redirect a page to. In cases of resource creation, it indicates the URL to the newly created resource.

Etag.description: identifier for a specific version of a resource. It lets caches be more efficient and save bandwidth

get.description: retrieves a blocked token and its created date if one exists

schema.description: This header returns the unique identifier for the resource that was just created.

The Location response header indicates the URL to redirect a page to. In cases of resource creation, it indicates the URL to the newly created resource. Ex: 'Location: /index.html'.  See RFC 7231, section 7.1.2: Location

get.summary: Retrieves a Terminal by terminal id

put.summary: Updates a Terminal by terminals id

delete.summary: Deletes a Terminal by terminals id

post.summary: Authorizes the amount requested for the person indicated.
post.description:
When a credit card is processed, the first step in the approval process is AUTHORIZING the amount requested by the business owner.
No money is actually moved during this part of the process but an imaginary hold is placed on the credit card, protecting the amount
of money the consumer spent. The merchant has less than 30 days to complete the process- if a merchant only Authorizes a transaction
and does not complete the process within the time frame, they will not be paid.

requestBody.description:
'
Required Field   | Description
---------------- | ----------------
orderId          | OrderId from add to cart. The commerce call should respond with a orderId to use to keep track of the order. (POST /shop/wcs/resources/store/{storeNumberId}/cart)  EX: "74228900000"
orderDate        | "2016-07-22 11:32:00"
amount           | The amount of the payment. EX: "2.55"
currencyCode     | Payment Currency. EX: "USD"
accountNumber    | This is the sample credit card number EX: 4111111111111111
expireYear       | YYYY - EX: "2028"
expireMonth      | MM - EX: "07"
cardSecurityCode | 3 or 4 digit security code,  EX: "1234"
performAvsCheck  | Perform Address Verification Check - true for US Addresses Only, false for International
skipSecurityCodeCheck  | Skip CVV check - true for card on file transactions, otherwise false
apikey           | External pointer used to lookup merchant bank information
merchantId       | Merchant identifier (supplied by POS) used to get merchant bank info. Used by Tap operation
termianlId       | Termianl identifier (supplied by POS) used to get merchant bank info. Used by Tap operation
**customer**     | The fields of the Customer Object
- firstName      | First Name
- lastName       | Last Name
- address1       | Address
- city           | City
- stateProvince  | State / Province
- postalCode     | Postal Code
- countryCode    | Country
- workPhone      | Work Phone
'

post.description:
When the business owner closes out their terminal at the end of the day, the CAPTURE process begins.
The money is now on the way to the account of the business owner.

requestBody.description:
'
Required Field   | Description
---------------- | ----------------
amount           | The amount to capture. EX: "48.40"
apikey           | External pointer used to lookup merchant bank information
requestId        | The ID of the request (Comes fromPOST /aci/auth) - EX: "200012345126"
'

post.description: Invoking this endpoint will perform and authorization / auto capture operation that will immediately start the process of capturing funds for the transaction.

requestBody.description:
'
Required Field   | Description

amount           | The amount of the payment. EX: "2.55"

post.summary: Undoes the posting of a ACI payment.

requestBody.description:
'
Required Field          | Description
----------------------- |------------
amount                  | The amount to refund. EX: "1.80"
apikey                  | Hardcoded value for APIKey - EX: "425a6904-5440-45f8-b902-6dcc355cc95b"
requestId               | The ID of the request (Comes fromPOST /aci/auth) - EX: "200012345126"
sameDay                 | If this is the same day the purchase was made or not:  EX: true
'

PreAuthorization Response Model * account_number - optional, used when authorizing PAN * token - optional, used when authorizing TOKEN * expire_year - required * expire_month - required * card_security_code - required * Additional Rules - If both account_number and token supplied, result is 400 Bad Request - If neither account_number or token supplied, result is 400 Bad Request

400.description: Bad Request - A request parameter is invalid.

Content-Type.description: The Content-Type entity header is used to indicate the media type of the resource. For errors the Content-Type should be 'application/problem+json'

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

invalid_parms.description: A list of exceptions for the operation by field.

problem.description: The uniquely identifiable (primary key) value of the problem that has occurred; the computer readable version of the problem.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization (e.g., using proactive content negotiation; see [RFC7231], Section 3.4).
title.example: Your request parameters did not validate

type.description: A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type. This specification encourages that, when dereferenced, it provide human-readable documentation for the  problem type (e.g., using HTML [W3C.REC-html5-20141028]). When this member is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".

500.description: Internal Server Error - A generic error indication for an unexpected server execution problem. This usually indicates an error in the service itself.

503.description: Service Unavailable - Service is (temporarily) not available (e.g. if a required component or downstream service is not available)client retry may be sensible.

post.summary: creates a JWT token for Cardinal

requestBody.description:
orderId (required) - The commerce call should respond with a orderId to use to keep track of the order.
Comes from WCS - (POST /shop/wcs/resources/store/{storeNumberId}/cart) - This call creates a cardinal token for that order.

standard_201_response.description: Created - The request succeeded, and a new resource was created as a result. This is typically the response sent after POST requests, or some PUT requests.

standard_204_response.description: No Content - There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful. The user agent may update its cached headers for this resource with the new ones.

standard_207_response.description: Multi-Status - The service has processed multiple independent resources, each with their own status codes. The response contains the processing status of every resource processed by this operation.

standard_304_error.description: Not Modified - This is used for caching purposes. It tells the client that the response has not been modified, so the client can continue to use the same cached version of the response.

standard_400_error.description: Bad Request - A request parameter is invalid.

standard_404_error.description: Not Found - The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future. Subsequent requests by the client are permissible.

standard_409_error.description: Conflict - Indicates that the request could not be processed because of conflict in the current state of the resource, such as an edit conflict between multiple simultaneous updates.

standard_412_error.description: Precondition Failed - The client has indicated preconditions in its headers which the server does not meet.

standard_422_error.description: Unprocessable Entity - The request body is is syntactically correct; however, an attribute value is incorrect.

standard_500_error.description: Internal Server Error - A generic error indication for an unexpected server execution problem.  This usually indicates an error in the service itself.

standard_503_error.description: Service Unavailable - Service is (temporarily) not available (e.g. if a required component or downstream service is not available) - client retry may be sensible.

api-key.description: api key reflecting source of transaction.  Populated from x-uniwebservice-apikey request header

card-on-file-mode.description: Indicating the mode of subsequent payment transaction

card-on-file-source.description: Indicating the type of subsequent payment transaction

card-on-file-initial-transaction-id.description: The value/ID is received as part of the acquirer response of a CIT flagged transaction

card-on-file-industry-practice.description:
The MIT types defined under this category are performed to fulfill a business practice 
as a follow-up to an original cardholder-merchant interaction that could not be 
completed with one single transaction

card-on-file-expiry.description: Recurring Expiry: Date after which no further authorizations shall be performed

card-on-file-frequency.description: Recurring Frequency: Indicates the minimum number of days between authorizations.

card-on-file-number-of-installments.description:
Installment Payment Data: Indicates the maximum number of authorisations 
permitted for installment payments

cvv.description: The card verification value or security code used to verify a user is authorized to use the card.

expire-month.description: The expiration month of the credit card

expire-year.description: The expiration year of the credit card

first-name-on-card.description: The first name as it appears on the Payment Card.

guest-id.description: UUID generated for the guest profile

last_four_digits.description: The last for digits of the payment card used.

last-name-on-card.description: The last name as it appears on the Payment Card.

payment-account-number.description:
The term primary account number refers to a 14-, 15-, 16-, or even up to 19-digit 
number generated as a unique identifier designated for a primary account

phone-number.description: The phone number on file for the payment method

request-id.description: The identifier of the payment request that can be used to reference the payment later.

response-security-description.example: Unsupported by issuer or issuer is unable to process request

same-day.description: Indicates if Reverse (true) or Refund (false) transaction performed against the transaction identifier.

token.description: The payment method token to charge

3ds-cavv.description: The 3D secure CAVV or AAV. Must be Base64 encoded.

3ds-eci-flag.description: The ECI for the 3D secure request

3ds-transaction-id.description: Transaction ID assigned by the directory server. Used when the transaction was already authenticated.

3ds-xid.description: The 3D secure xid if available. Must be Base64 encoded.

path_resort-area-code.name: resort-area-code
path_resort-area-code.description: A uniquely identifying value for the resort area.

path_merchant-id.name: merchant-id
path_merchant-id.description: An identifying value for the merchant_id
